title: ISO 9000 - QMS Family & Fundamental Principles
headline: In this free online course, learn about the ISO 9000:2015 fundamentals of QMS and the ISO 9000 family of standards.
description: ISO 9000 is a standard that specifically covers the basic terms and concepts of quality management systems (QMS). It is thus generally referred to as the family of QMS standards. This ‘family’ is designed to help companies to comply with and exceed the needs of customers and other stakeholders. This course also explains the ISO 9000 singular standard along with a precise overview of standards covered by the ISO 9000 family.
courseDescription:
ISO 9000:2015 standard covers the fundamentals of quality management systems (QMS), along with the eight quality management principles on which the ISO 9000 family of standards is built. In comparison, the popular ISO 9001 only presents the auditable requirements for QMS against which an organization can be certified through certification audits. This course discusses the ISO 9000 family along with the specific ISO 9000 standard on fundamentals and vocabulary.

This course enlightens you not only on QMS principles but how to incorporate them within the culture of an entire organization. The principles are also explained in terms of their advantages which can be used to convince top management to adopt the ISO 9000 family of standards. The course covers all concepts and terms of this standard without any exception.

It also covers the implementation steps of ISO 9000/9001 standards, which are explained one by one, along with their significance and contribution to the implementation process. You will learn about each topic while comprehending all the concepts they explain, which will further help you to understand the entire QMS. The course also comes with a lesson summary and an assessment to strengthen your freshly acquired skills. Register today!

Start Course Now

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Discuss the case for the quality management system (QMS), to top management, with the help of showcasing ISO 9000 principles' advantages.
    • Summarize the different QMS concepts and principles.
    • List the standards in ISO 9000 family along with their specific use.
    • Explain the differences between systems, processes and activities in a QMS. 
    • Distinguish between different QMS terms in the context of their application. 
    • List the major steps of implementing ISO 9000/ISO 9001.
    • Discuss the importance of each step in implementing ISO 9000.

  • The ISO 9000 Family

  • ISO 9000 is the family of quality management systems (QMS) standards. It is a complete set of standards that empowers companies to ascertain that they fulfill the customer and other needs of interested parties, especially those having applicable regulatory or statutory requirements concerning a product or service. ISO 9000 family deals with the following: 

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

    • Fundamentals of Quality Management System (QMS).
    • The seven quality management principles.
    • ISO 9001 is one of the renowned standards in the family, which exclusively deals with the auditable requirements for organizations. So it is the only standard for which an organization can acquire compliance certification. 
    • There is one more standard with the title of ISO 9000, which we will cover in this online course. The ISO 9000:2015 is entitled "Quality management systems — Fundamentals and vocabulary." Therefore, ISO 9000 is also a guideline standard, along with its representation as a family. 
    • We recommend it to take the course on ISO 9001, along with this course to understand the family in a better way. There is already a comprehensive course on ISO 9001 on Alison, which can be enrolled for free. The course is entitled as "ISO 9001:2015 - Quality Management System (QMS)".

  • The Philosophy of the ISO 9000 Standard

  • The quality management concepts and principles described in ISO 9000 offer the organization the capacity to comply with challenges offered by an environment that is extremely different from the last decades. Rapid changes, markets' globalization, and the exposure of knowledge as a valuable resource individualize the context in which an organization operates today. Quality can have a direct influence on the company's reputation.

    • Management System
      It is defined in clause 3.5.3 of ISO 9000:2015 as a set of interrelated or interacting elements of an organization to establish policies and objectives and processes to achieve those objectives. 

      Additional notes are: 

      - A management system can address a single discipline or several disciplines, e.g. quality management, financial management, or environmental management. 
      - The management system elements establish the organization's structure, roles and responsibilities, planning, operation, policies, practices, rules, beliefs, objectives and processes to achieve those objectives. 
      - The scope of a management system can include the whole of the organization, and specific and identified functions of the organization, specific. and identified sections of the organization or one or more functions across a group of organizations.

  • Lesson Summary

    • New Tab
      Enter your text here..
      Enter your text here..
    • About ISO 9000 Family
      • ISO 9000 is collectively called as family of quality management systems (QMS) standards.
      • ISO 9001:2015 is one of the renowned standards in the family which exclusively deals with the auditable requirements for organizations.
      • The ISO 9000:2015 is entitled "Quality management systems — Fundamentals and vocabulary." Therefore, ISO 9000 is also a guideline standard, along with its representation as a family. The ISO 9000 standard covers fundamental concepts and terminologies of the quality management system (QMS).
      • ISO/TS 9002:2016 is another standard on Quality management systems — Guidelines for the application of ISO 9001:2015
      • ISO 9003:1994: Quality systems — Model for quality assurance in last inspection and test. It was withdrawn and incorporated as part of ISO 9001 in the year 2000. So ISO 9001 covers that. 
      • ISO 9004:2018: Quality Management - Quality of an Organization - Guidance to Achieve Sustained Success (continuous improvement)
      • ISO 9000 is collectively called as family of quality management systems (QMS) standards.
      • ISO 9001:2015 is one of the renowned standards in the family which exclusively deals with the auditable requirements for organizations.
      • The ISO 9000:2015 is entitled "Quality management systems — Fundamentals and vocabulary." Therefore, ISO 9000 is also a guideline standard, along with its representation as a family. The ISO 9000 standard covers fundamental concepts and terminologies of the quality management system (QMS).
      • ISO/TS 9002:2016 is another standard on Quality management systems — Guidelines for the application of ISO 9001:2015
      • ISO 9003:1994: Quality systems — Model for quality assurance in last inspection and test. It was withdrawn and incorporated as part of ISO 9001 in the year 2000. So ISO 9001 covers that. 
      • ISO 9004:2018: Quality Management - Quality of an Organization - Guidance to Achieve Sustained Success (continuous improvement)
    • About ISO 9000 Standard
      • There are seven principles of quality management in ISO 9000:
      PQMS 1: Customer focus
      PQMS 2: Leadership
      PQMS 3: Engagement of people
      PQMS 4: A process approach
      PQMS 5: Improvement
      PQMS 6: Evidence-based decision making
      PQMS 7: Relationship management
      • There are so many concepts, terms and definitions in the ISO 9000 standard.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:

    • Recall what a metrological characteristic is.
    • Indicate the implementation program steps.
    • Recognize the importance of drafting an implementation plan.
    • Describe the deviation permit.

  • Introduction to ISO 9000 Implementation Program

  • Before going to the ISO 9000 implementation program, it is important to understand the difference between ISO 9000 and ISO 9001. Also, students need to understand what is meant by the ISO 9000 implementation program.
    • New Tab
      Enter your text here..
      Enter your text here..
    • Status of ISO 9000 Versus ISO 9001
      ISO 9000 standalone standard provides only guidance on principles of quality management as well as covers the fundamental concepts and terms. These principles can be implemented. However, this standard does not provide specific requirements for the quality management system. ISO 9001 is the only auditable standard for general quality management systems which offers requirements for organizations to comply with.
      ISO 9000 standalone standard provides only guidance on principles of quality management as well as covers the fundamental concepts and terms. These principles can be implemented. However, this standard does not provide specific requirements for the quality management system. ISO 9001 is the only auditable standard for general quality management systems which offers requirements for organizations to comply with.
    • What is meant by ISO 9000 Implementation, then?
      When we talk about ISO 9000 implementation, it means that the organization has understood the ISO 9000 quality management principles along with its basic concepts and terms. Understanding is not enough for ISO 9000 implementation. It does also mean that the organization has taken some substantial steps in order to comply with ISO 9001. Because ISO 9001 is the only standard that provides requirements for the organization. So therefore, after understanding the basics of ISO 9000, organizations need to move towards the implementation of the ISO 9001 standards.

So therefore, after understanding the basics of ISO 9000, organizations need to move towards the implementation of the ISO 9001 standards.

  • Lesson Summary

  • Here's a summary of the main clauses in ISO 9000.
    • Metrological confirmation is defined as a set of operations required to ensure that measuring equipment conforms to the requirements for its intended use.
    • Vision is an aspiration of what an organization would like to become, as expressed by top management.
    • Mission is the organization's purpose for existing as expressed by top management.
    • Strategy is a plan to achieve a long-term or overall objective.
    • Policy is the intentions and direction of an organization as formally expressed by its top management.
    • Quality is the degree to which a set of inherent characteristics of an object fulfills requirements.
    • Grade is a category or rank given to different requirements for an object having the same functional use. 
    • Statutory Requirement is an obligatory requirement specified by a legislative body.
    • Regulatory requirement is an obligatory requirement specified by an authority mandated by a legislative body.
    • Defect is a nonconformity related to an intended or specified use.
